availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: John G. Twyman (Louisville, Kentucky, blacksmith, engineer, and tavernkeeper)

body.p: Louisville, Kentucky, blacksmith, engineer, and tavernkeeper. Kentucky native. Son of William Twyman and Marjorie Lucky Twyman. Married to Maria Kiffin Twyman in Jefferson County, Kentucky, on October 17, 1853. Father of Caroline Twyman. Blacksmith in Louisville in 1850. Household owned seven enslaved persons in Louisville in 1850. Steamboat engineer in Louisville in 1860. Arrested and gave bond to the United States for selling liquor to soldiers in Louisville in March 1864. Tavernkeeper in partnership with John Herron in Louisville in 1865.
